```{r}
library(gt)
library(dplyr)

# Create dataset ideas table
one_sample_ideas <- tribble(
  ~Theme, ~Dataset_Idea, ~Variable, ~Comparison_Mean, ~Teaching_Angle,
  "Psychology / Social Science", "Perceived stress", "PSS total score", "20 (college average)", "Introduce psychometric data and assumptions",
  "Psychology / Social Science", "Hours of sleep", "Average nightly sleep", "7 hours", "Highlight normality and how to check it",
  "Psychology / Social Science", "Self-esteem scores", "Mean SE score", "25", "Show confidence intervals & interpret direction",
  "Psychology / Social Science", "Social media use", "Daily hours", "3 hours", "Frame nulls from 'claims' or 'recommendations'",

  "Campus Life / Student Engagement", "Sense of belonging", "Belonging score", "5 (neutral)", "Connect to sampling theory — does this campus differ?",
  "Campus Life / Student Engagement", "Satisfaction with cafeteria food", "Rating (1–10)", "6", "Discuss Likert scales as interval data",
  "Campus Life / Student Engagement", "Commute time", "Minutes to campus", "15 minutes", "Use skewed data to discuss violations of normality",
  "Campus Life / Student Engagement", "Study hours per week", "Self-reported hours", "10", "Show one-tailed vs. two-tailed testing",

  "Health & Behavior", "Resting heart rate", "BPM", "70", "Real-world normality checks",
  "Health & Behavior", "Caffeine consumption", "mg per day", "200", "Discuss population benchmarks & variability",
  "Health & Behavior", "Daily steps", "Steps per day", "10,000", "Contrast statistical vs. practical significance",
  "Health & Behavior", "Reaction time", "Milliseconds", "300 ms", "Connect to experimental psychology",

  "Pop Culture / Fun", "Music tempo preference", "BPM of favorite songs", "120", "Use Spotify or open music data",
  "Pop Culture / Fun", "Horror tolerance", "Scary rating (1–10)", "5", "Tie to morbid curiosity and affective science",
  "Pop Culture / Fun", "Pet cuteness ratings", "Rating (1–10)", "7", "Teach sampling bias playfully",
  "Pop Culture / Fun", "TikTok usage", "Minutes per day", "60", "Use real-skew distributions for discussion",

  "Professional Development", "Job satisfaction", "Rating (1–10)", "6", "Practice effect size interpretation",
  "Professional Development", "Typing speed", "Words per minute", "50", "Show parametric assumptions with skill data",
  "Professional Development", "Confidence using AI tools", "Rating (1–10)", "5", "Discuss modern relevance & comfort with tech"
)

# Format the table for presentation
one_sample_ideas |>
  gt(groupname_col = "Theme") |>
  cols_label(
    Dataset_Idea = "Dataset Idea",
    Variable = "Variable (DV)",
    Comparison_Mean = "Comparison Mean (H₀)",
    Teaching_Angle = "Teaching Angle"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = md("**Ideas for One-Sample *t*-Test Lab Datasets**")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(md("Table generated with **GPT-5 (OpenAI, 2025)**")) |>
  tab_options(
    table.font.size = 16,
    table.width = pct(100),
    data_row.padding = px(6),
    row_group.background.color = "#F5F7FB",   # subtle background for groups
    row_group.as_column = FALSE,              # ensure group labels appear as section headers
    row_group.font.weight = "bold"            # ensures visibility
  ) |>
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(weight = "bold", color = "#005BBB"),
    locations = cells_column_labels(everything())
  ) |>
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(weight = "bold", color = "#1D4ED8", size = px(18)), # blue bold group titles
    locations = cells_row_groups()
  ) |>
  opt_table_outline() |>
  opt_row_striping()

```
